comment_message: Get better, Adele. 121 shows in this tour? You are pushing yourself too hard, especially since you've had this problem before. Take care of yourself. Pace yourself! We love you and don't want you to destroy your voice just to perform for us.

We wish for your speedy recovery, Adele! üíñüíñüíñ It was so noble of you to personally apologize and explain your situation though you need not to do those things. You are such an amazing artist with a big heart! üëèüëèüëèThe weather was really not nice during Adele's first of 4 finale concerts in London and performing in Wembley stadium in that kind of weather will definitely affect her voice. One need not to be a doctor to know this for a fact. As for us who chose to travel to see a concert, we should always be prepared for the outcome of the risk that we have taken. Watching concert abroad is quite risky because there's a lot of money at stake from plane tickets, hotel accomodations, taking time off from work (for those who wouldn't be there if not for the concert) and the concert tickets. For the concert tickets, of course it is refundable. Problem arises when tickets are sold out and the only way to get tickets is from ticket touts. Unfortunately tickets bought from ticket touts will not be refunded by Songkick. That is another risk that a person should expect when buying tickets from ticket touts. It is understandable that people get frustrated because of disappointment over something you look forward to for so many months and incurred losses, especially for those who save up and travelled to London just to watch Adele live. For those who are travelling to watch a concert, always remember, it's good to have a back up plan (think of other things you can do in case the concert has been cancelled). For now, just make something good out of the situation, make an alternative plan. üòÑ So at least your trip to London is not totally a waste of money. üòò

Ariel Hazan - I'm a professional voice coach - understanding the function of the voice applied with its anatomical structure . I'd like to point out to you that even the healthiest of voices can develop problems such a nodules - it's not always down to a "ideal" technique. I happen to know that Adele had seen a top leading voice expert, the issue does not like with her technique and she has really learnt to not use what we call "pressed phonation" (which is what I believe you're referring to).

If you're an athlete and you train and stretch appropriately, there is still no 100% guarantee that you won't pull or tear muscle - and If this happens it doesn't make you unprofessional, but human. The voice is a very versatile and complex instrument. But there has been no unprofessionalism from this marvellous women. 

I know it's really sad for fans who don't get to see their hero, but voice has to be rested to stop any further unhealthy vocal production from occurring. 

Added note: 
It's not that she "pushed" in her last two concerts that has caused swelling of the vocal folds. This is very often something that happens over a long period of time, even by spoken voice and with a good technique to "support" the larynx (voice-box)

Best, Josh.

ADELE - Our daughter is a talented young singer/ songwriter who adores you (as do we). You have been a massive inspiration to her in her fledgling career - how you look, sound, conduct yourself, treat your fans - everything...As soon as you announced your tour dates, we knew that was her 2015 Christmas present - tickets for all four of us to come and see you live. The morning they went on sale, we were in Prague so my husband and I spent the final four hours of our stay on phones and tablets in our hotel room trying in vain to get onto the ticketing site. We were gutted but that's life. When, last year you released more tickets, we tried again - this time successfully (!) and had to keep that secret for the rest of that year so we could give them to Anna for her 2016 Christmas present. Needless to say she was so excited - and has been from then to now. Right now she is still asleep and is unaware of your sad news. BUT when she wakes up and hears that Sunday is cancelled she will, of course, have a moment of disappointment. Adele! 

It's Thursday night & we're right here At Wembley to see Adele 
Her voice is just so magical 
She'll put us under her spell 

A massive crowd has gathered 
Just to listen to Adele 
There's over ninety thousand 
Tickets were quick to sell 

Anticipation is building 
As we're waiting for Adele 
She's gonna come out swearing 
'Hello Wembley, fucking hell!' 

The eyes on the big screen open 
Beautiful eyes of Adele 
She starts to sing 'Hello' 
And the crowd sing along as well  
After a few songs she stops to chat In the style of Adele 
'My songs are just moaning 'bout ex's' 'That's the story I always tell' 

An angry & serious moment 
With a heartfelt plea from Adele 
To donate & support the survivors Of the tragedy that was Grenfell 

A spectacle of lighting & fireworks As videos scrolled of Adele 
She shot t-shirts into the crowd 
And put notes on confetti that fell  
Thanks for the fantastic concert 
We hope you heard us yell 
Your music is bloody awesome 
We love you Adele, Adele! 

 ¬© The Keynsham Poet ‚Äì NIEH 29.06.17

How would you suggest going about cancelling a gig due to illness with any sort of forewarning?
This is Adele's day job, and just like with ANY day job, if you call the boss telling him/her you're gonna be too sick to work about a month from now, you're not gonna get a positive reply.
When you're sick you call in sick, and the more people that depend on you being at your job, the longer you try to fight off illness and "just do it".
When an artist cancel a sold out arena due to illness you can bet your butt that she or he is really REALLY sick.
I get it, things cost money. I have, believe it or not, been in the exact same situation. Flew to the event, stayed at a hotel and was in the arena AT THE GIG when it was cancelled. So I get it.
But to be pissed off at an artist for not performing when physically unable to is just bad form.
You lost some money on this, suck it up. You'll either get your ticket money back, or you'll get a fucking AWESOME replacement gig in the near future.
You took the risk when you decided to travel for a concert. Shit happens. You'll get over it
Maybe don't blow your savings just to see 1 show...

As any parent would do we stayed by her side constantly day / night  but sadly complications set in by 10 day mark and life as we know was never going to be the same again, 29/5/2017 we had to make the heartbreaking decision to turn the machines off & say our last goodbye to our beautiful daughter, 31/5/2017 @ 6:00am my daughter had passed away peacefully we were right by her side. Dang yall! I looked at the comments thinking I would see all kinds of encouragement and well wishes. But half of whatI see are a bunch of self-serving assholes. I cant believe this woman is sick and sick to death that she cant please y'all. And now I see why. Y'all are hateful. 121 shows is a huge accomplishment. That is also a huge strain and pressure on the vocals. There needs to be more education and support for singers and to help people understand that the instrument of the voice is not the same as another like a guitar or piano. The vocals and heart are linked. If someone is tired then their vocals are affected. If someone is going through a personal situation, their vocals are affected. If you speak too loud at a family gathering one day then the vocals are affected the next day. Just a few examples. I cannot imagine the huge pressure to have to sing perfectly every single time and at every single concert. The "people" behind these artists need to look after their artists more and their instrument, their voices. There is a reason why legendary singers like Bette Midler will only sing once a week maximum. It is sad to me to see artists feeling so guilty and so sad for something that is essentially out of their control - the voice is a powerful but sensitive instrument. This is beyond her control. 121 shows was pushing it already. I wish more people in the industry would understand this and look after these artists properly x
Well said Monica! I completely agree. 121 shows is way too much. I'm lucky to have been around on Thursday at Wembley and saw her perform. Bless you Adele! Get well. xx

I know it's highly unlikely you'll see this message, but Adele please do what you have to do. Your voice and your health are far more important than two shows, if you can't reschedule them then so be it, please listen to the doctors and professionals and do what they say! If you do reschedule please make sure you give yourself plenty of time to recover, even if that means rescheduling for next year, we'd prefer you to be 100% and not doing more damage to yourself.

Yes, I understand you don't want to let people down (considering miming did make me chuckle - I just can't see you ever doing that!), but you come first, you only have one voice, it's precious, please don't harm it any further. xx

Let's start with the fact that I am not a big fan of Adele, I am just a fan of the good music. However, I respect and appreciate the really good music that she creates. My friends and I bought several tickets for the Wembley show on 1st of July 7 months ago. It is superfluous to say how disappointed we was last morning noticing that the show was canceled. Most of the people who were supposed to attend the concert are not from London, not event from UK. They had to book flights and hotel. What about these expenses? We were highly disappointed for the ruined weekend but we still understood Adele's reasons for not performing last night. After receiving the information that the concerts won't be performed at all in future for which we will get refund and that if there are any concerts, we will have to purchase tickets again, I can't remain silent. Does Adele even suppose what a battle was for purchasing these tickets??? Does she know how did she ruin some people's dreams? I guess, No. She was obliged to reschedule the last two concerts allowing all these people to make their dream comes true. This is not just a frivolous attitude, this is not even mocking. She doesn't respect her fans.

Shite. However, I fully understand - if I'm going to see Adele, it's to hear those magnificent vocals live, and I wouldn't want to be there with her in pain or having to mime. Such a shame, but better to be honest and upfront than risk disappointing fans by cutting a show short or miming to a track. I wish Adele a speedy recovery - I was really looking forward to hearing her live, but this is the way the cookie crumbles.

Hi Adele/ Adele Management, 
I am writing from a producer of Karaoke Tracks in the UK (Dorset) called Vocal Star Limited.  
We, along with all other Karaoke producers have been informed from PRS that we are no longer able to sell any Adele tracks for digital or streaming of karaoke purposes.  In January, no Adele tracks will be allowed on disc either. 
This means no Karaoke company will be able to supply any Adele tracks in any format what so ever, meaning your fans will not be able to sing along to your tracks at home, in karaoke bars or anywhere in Karaoke form. 
We as one of the largest suppliers of Karaoke music and products know that this is going to upset a lot of fans around the World.
I can‚Äôt believe that you are aware of this, or would accept this and we would love to hear some official comment on this. 
Jay

As someone who has once been at a huge concert, listened to two opening acts and then watched - in disbelief - as members of the band I was expecting to see, had paid money to see, had travelled on a plane to see and booked a hotel to see, stepped up on stage and made a heartfelt apology to everyone that they needed to cancel the show due to illness, I can't help feeling that some of the people commenting here are nothing but petty, self centered oafs.
Pick any tired phrase you like:
Shit happens!
It's only money!
Life goes on!
They're all true. Make the most of the situation, and spend time in the big L doing fun things.
If the shows can't be rescheduled you'll get your ticket money back.
But if they CAN be rescheduled, you're probably in for a treat! The band I wanted to see rescheduled, and that concert was two hours of performance from musicians absolutely HELL BENT on giving all of their returning fans more than enough value for money! It was real, live gratitude and love pouring out from that stage. And we, the audience, responded in kind.
Just cheer up, will ya.
It's not the end of the world!

Her voice is amazing but she is only human and only has one voice. If she continues to overwork it, it may go altogether. Her children need her more than we do. Get well soon Adele xx

Adele, you should not have to appoligize for a career threatening ailment! Take care of yourself, follow Drs. orders and hopefully those vocal cords will heal! Gods speed and sending you prayers for God to bring you back to perfect health! ((((( <3 )))))

I had the honor of seeing you in Austin TX and you blew me away, not with your voice, because that already had blown me away over the past several years with your recorded music - I knew you would be fantastic and were, but instead I was blown away with how real and accessible you are to everyone at your shows.  You made every one of us at that concert feel like you were our friend, and that you were thankful to us for being there.  Are you kidding me??!!  You are a MEGA talent and yet you have remained true to yourself - a gorgeous, funny, humble, REAL person with a voice like no other.  I will be a fan for life after seeing who you are.  Your show was more about spending an evening with you than hearing your singing, which was not what I expected.  You really are an amazing human being.

I wish I could sit you down, with a glass of wine, and tell you myself that you have nothing to apologize for and that you are simply amazing as a person (and obviously as a singer).  You gave the world your all, and you simply have no more.  As a mom of two special needs children, I get this!!!  Parenting them is my greatest source of happiness but I never know when I'm going to be running on fumes and have no more to give.  And at times I have to say "no more" and let others down.  I surround myself with people who understand when I just can't give anymore and don't judge when I bail on them.  If your fans don't read this and understand, then give them their money back and don't think twice about it.  If they only love you for your talent, let them download a song or something.  Those who admire you for all that you are will understand. 

Take care, rest and don't beat yourself up.  There will be other chances to put yourself out there for others.  We need that gorgeous voice of yours to stay strong, and for your contagious laugh, and your amazing soul to remain open and real!!

A fan for life....

Fully understanding that a professional needs to take care of herself, to me the organization of this whole tour has been a disaster. It was almost impossible to get tickets for the regular shows around the world as tickets would disappear in minutes and most of them would reappear minutes later in re-sale websites at 2-3 times the price (which is completely illegal). Then you had to subscribe to the fans website to get tickets for today's "last concert" jus to see that once you got the tickets, the one last concert became 3-4 concerts in a row... No top artist do that! Max. 2 concerts in consecutive nights. But 4? It's all about the money... Not the fans. Don't get confused. I hope they will foresee full refund even if they reschedule for the hundreds and thousands coming from abroad...

If, in order to do that which brings so much joy to others, you face the destruction of that very thing, to continue would be madness. In time, the damage to your voice will heal and you will adapt to whatever consequences are left in its wake, but for now you have to do what is right for your health, your career, and the gift you have. You have no need to ask forgiveness for doing what is right.

Here's the thing: The concert that was planned to take place yesterday (sunday) was announced to be the last in a while. That was the only concert planned and announced at that moment. People bought tickets. 

Then two more concerts were announced -extra concerts. Those took place -before- the original concert. 

And then the original concert ended up being cancelled. 

People will get their money back. But the seats are gone and all they can do is hope to get great seats at a concert, that nobody knows when will take place. 

While I do understand that being sick is out of ones control, someone really blew it at this one (I don't know if that is management or someone else). 

I can understand why people with tickets to the original concert are more than dissapointed.

I'm a great believer in things happening for a reason. Perhaps, London is your golden crown. Your hometown. It's gotta be good and maybe different from all the other performances.
You're body's telling you, "enough girl".
Your fans will of course be disappointed, but will understand. One of the things that makes you different from other artists is you keep it real. You know where you're from and you haven't forgotten what it's like to not be in the limelight. 
Go get well. Book another date and blow 'em all away. They will understand and come see you in a few months.
PS: Please keep touring. They will come üòä

2 VIP tickets for today's show were my Christmas gift from my husband. Coming over from Beirut, Lebanon and having all of our trip to London revolving around today's show, I am totally gutted to hear that the show has been cancelled. We all wish Adele good health and a speedy recovery, but We will not be able to come back to the UK in the near future to see her again when the concert is rescheduled. I think, it would have been better if she kept the show on and lip synced in respect and gratitude to all the people who came to see her from all over the world. Knowing that the trip cost us more than 2,500 ¬£ (including travel and hotel accommodation), it is the emotional experience that I regret not being able to feel by watching her, more that the concerns about the money spent and potential refunds. We love you Adele. Get well soon.

Prayers to you!! Your voice and amazing personality are what us fans love, which is why you must absolutely make it #1 priority! Oh girl, don't beat yourself up! Your fans will understand because your health, and preserving that beautiful voice for us to hear from years to come, does and should take center stage. You are amazing just to do all you have accomplished to date. Be proud and hold your head high!

Gal, you gotta look after yourself and your voice/throat. Singing was central to my work as a music specialist in primary education. One day I suddenly found I was unable to pitch my notes. To cut a long story short I went through two throat operations and 37 radiotherapy sessions for laryngeal cancer and  though I have come through it I am not unscathed and still cannot sing after 4 1/2 yrs, My speaking voice is unreliable . My advice to you is take time out and do what has to be done, get the very best speech therapist and  go easy on yourself. I wish you all the luck and love on the world. You deserve it.

This must have been such a difficult decision to make Adele! I'm not  disappointed to miss the show but relieved you made the decision you have. There is nothing more important than listening to your body and having the professional pride in what you do to know not to go ahead with the last two gigs. I saw you in 2011 at RAH and you were on top of your game... you still are! Get well and do what the doctor tells you. See you again soon. Much love and best wishes. Ashleigh

Exactly what I'm going through at the moments. I have vocal polyps & am not allowed to sing. I have an incredible speech pathologist & going through intensive therapy starting next month. It's so worth it though. We are in it for the long haul not just the short term. You want to last the distance, not be another artist out of action at 50. You can do this Adele. You are incredibly gifted. I have learnt more in the silence these last 4 months than I ever could have up to my usual antics. You will learn so much about yourself & life, I just know you'll be a better & more refined you, and even better vocally at the end of this time. It's heartbreaking. The voice of talented singers is akin to the legs of a cyclist, the arms of a ball player, etc. Injuries such as that of Adele are akin to sprains and strains. Though unseen, the voice is injured and must be cared for carefully, allowing full healing & recovery. Then therapy, gradually bringing it to par & strengthened to avoid injury again. As hard as this long process takes, Adele, take the rest of the year and come back to us very strong. So many have told of returning too soon And never having their old capabilities return. I bet you will then have enough new material as well; perhaps for Xmas. A true gift to your fans. And be sure to have a good agent who will push on airplay meanwhile. Meanwhile enjoy your forced sabbatical.  We will  enjoy your music. Take care.

Unfortunately, the performance of a voice of singer cannot be guaranteed and sometimes a singer is facing events that require it to take a long rest.

When I noticed that something was wrong with my voice, at first I thought it was a beginning of infection. The medical examination, however, has given a different result: the side effects of a medicine made burst a small vein on my vocal cords.

So I must stop singing until the haematoma has completely subsided. To avoid permanent damage.

Adele this letter is what makes you a star - to show such humility when you didn't have to, to have the strength to be so raw & bare your soul to your adoring public, to take the time to even say one "I am sorry", to acknowledge your fans like this - THIS is what makes you a REAL star - your voice & talent that you share with us is a bonus - thank you Adele for being so real - I have a new respect for you & my hope for a better humanity is a little restored - Oprah once said that in order to give the best of you, you must first take care of you & that is not selfish - it is thoughtful & wise & actually very generous because you are taking care of yourself only so you can take care of others - so Adele you have not failed in not " finishing" - look after & heal your vocal cords so that you can give of your gift for a long time to come & be ready & rested for the next tour which will come at the right time & you will feel & instinctively know it is the right time - God Bless Adele & take the greatest care.

You are making the right decision by not performing on damaged vocal chords. You don't want to risk permanently damaging them beyond repair and finding that you can't talk either! Adele is a victim of a common occurance among young singers. A lack of professional voice instruction which could solve many of the issues which cause her problems. She needs to learn more about modifying her consonants and vowels in order to reduce pressure and stress on the vocal cords. This is a simple matter and one that is done regularly in the classical voice but commonly not known in the pop world because of a lack of instruction in the matter. With enough work Adele could be singing for another 50 years. If she does not seek this type of instruction it would be a shame.

Certain words and specific consonants and vowels in the songs Adele sings are causing her vocal distress. There are techniques to lessen this distress by modifying the words, without distorting them, in order to relieve the pressure on her vocal cords. If she pursues these remedies she can give the cords a rest, let them heal, no more operations and then resume singing in a healthy manner for many years. Please do this.

Hi Adele, I was absolutely gutted the early hours of this morning when I read you had to cancel your shows as I was really looking forward to your Sunday show. With that being at the same time I really appreciate you taking the time to write this statement to your fans expressing how devastating and gutted you were that you had to make this decision which I know you wouldn't have taken lightly. It just shows what a class act you are not all singers I know would take the time to do this like you have and I'm sure I safe this for everyone we appreciate you taking the time to write this very hard statement of your sincerest apologies it couldn't have been easy for you to have written this. It has actually been hard for me too to find the words of what to say and write to you as I'm not very good at this type of thing at all but I really felt I had to write this. You have nothing to be sorry for things happen and it can't be helped all that matters is your health and wellbeing. You are right to follow your Doctors advice your health most come 1st and you have to protect that precious voice of yours. It's not worth totally ruining your voice for. I have not had a performance or a task to do at work that I had to cancel that would have affected so many people.  But, I have had to quit something at a very busy time due to a medical condition that prevented me from doing the work I needed to.  I had 200 employees I supported and 1600 students depending on me.  Small in comparison to your numbers, but pressure, nonetheless.  And I wanted to do the work, but I couldn't.  

In that moment, I thought it was the end of the world and a horrible blemish on my career.  However, turns out it wasn't near as devastating as I thought it might be.  Take care of you.  I know you love performing and care about your commitment to your craft.  However, if you are not well, you can NEVER do this.  Your health matters!  Much love to you and be kind to yourself while you work through this.

When Minuchihr had heard these words he spake and said ‚Äî

‚ÄúMy desire is not after these men, neither is my longing after blood but mercy. Let every man lay down his arms and go his ways, and let peace be in the land, and joy wait upon your feet.‚Äù

When the men heard this they praised the Shah, and called down blessings upon his head. And they came before him, every man bearing his armour and the weapons of battle. And they laid them at his feet, and of weapons there was reared a mighty mountain, and the blue steel glistened in the sun. Then Minuchihr dismissed them graciously. And when the army was dispersed he sent a messenger unto Feridoun bearing the head of Silim and a writing. And when he had ordered all things he set out at the head of his warriors unto the city of Feridoun. And his grandsire came forth to meet him, and there came with him many elephants swathed in gold, and warriors arrayed in rich attire, and a large multitude clad in garments of bright hue. And flags waved above them, and trumpets brayed, and cymbals clashed, and sounds of rejoicing filled the air. But when Minuchihr saw that his grandsire came towards him, he got from his horse and ran to meet him, and fell at his feet and craved his blessing. And Feridoun blessed Minuchihr and raised him from the dust. And he bade him sit again upon his horse and took his hand, and they entered the city in triumph. And when they were come to the King‚Äôs house, Feridoun seated Minuchihr upon a throne of gold. Then he called unto him Saum, the son of Neriman, and said ‚Äî

‚ÄúI pray thee bring up this youth and nourish him for the kingdom, and aid him with thy might and mind.‚Äù

And he took the hand of Minuchihr and put it into that of Saum, and said ‚Äî

‚ÄúThanks be unto God the merciful, who hath listened unto my voice, and granted the desires of His servant. For now shall I go hence, and the world will I cumber no more.‚Äù

Hi Adele,

I love your voice.  I love your style.  Ever since the first time I heard you, I thought there is absolutely no other who compares.  I'm just one of your many, many fans.  I doubt I would have ever been able to afford one of your concerts.  Both tickets or the trip to a bigger city would have been a big dent in my savings.  But I never get tired of your voice and style even with the way American radio stations seem to play a song to death when it first comes out.  LAUGH.  I heard a DJ say some other person, dare I say artist, wanted to out sell or out do you. He's ok.  For a 'mussed' redhead.  I admit to using one of his tunes for a ringtone.  Shrug.   What seemed to be his first two hit got real old real fast.

I saw your very moving note to your Wembley fans.  I so pray your throat gets better.   For you and your health and family most of all.  I hope your two men in your life really know how fortunate they are to have you.  I would be so proud to be your mom. A quite youthful mom or a bit older sister.  Laugh.  

I will stop so I don't ramble longer.  Giggle.

Sincerely,

Beth 

from Virginia USA

Dear Adele,
I know you would never cancel such an inportant show if It wasn't for a really good reason. And of course I wish you get well soon. But I also have to admit that I am more then disappointed. I have bee looking forward to seeing you in concert for a long long time and it took me a while to save enough money to afford the ticket, flight and hotel to come all the way from Germany. So all in all I spend almost 1000 Euro of my hard earned money for nothing. And i didn't get any conpensation at all. I know people can get sick and there is nothing u can do about it. But why do we, your fans, have to pay for it. Today I got the refund for my ticket from Eventim. And guess what I didn't even get back what I payed for. All I got was the face value. What about the sevice fee, shipping cost...? So not only that I lost my money for fligh and hotel. I also lost 20 Pounds on the ticket which I will never see again. 
I am just really disappointed about the whole situation. I don't blame you for cancelling the show, not at all. But I think we deserver something better than a refund on the face value of the ticket. U got more money than u will ever be able to spend in your life. So you shouldn't let your fans pay for your health problems. 
I am really sad about that.
But anyway, please get well soon and go on with your music which makes us all feel good in so many ways.

We love you anyway and you have given us so much with your music, take this time as it is time for us to give back to you. Please take care of yourself, it would be a shame if you damage yourself for our pleasure. Your loving fan.
